name: Don't Stop 'Til You Get Enough
wikiSummary: Don't Stop 'til You Get Enough was the first hit single from Michael Jackson’s 1979 Off the Wall album, his first album with Epic Records and the first solo record over which he had creative control. Released July 28, 1979, the song was written and composed by Jackson himself in late 1978, with Quincy Jones producing.  On February 20, 2006, "Don’t Stop 'til You Get Enough" was re-released as part of the Visionary: The Video Singles, peaking at #17 in the UK.
wikiText:
Don't Stop 'til You Get Enough was the first hit single from Michael Jackson’s 1979 Off the Wall album, his first album with Epic Records and the first solo record over which he had creative control. Released July 28, 1979, the song was written and composed by Jackson himself in late 1978, with Quincy Jones producing.
 
 On February 20, 2006, "Don’t Stop 'til You Get Enough" was re-released as part of the Visionary: The Video Singles, peaking at #17 in the UK.
 
 The music video made for "Don’t Stop 'til You Get Enough" was directed and produced by Nick Saxton. It made its world premiere in October 1979, featuring a smiling Jackson floating over a background of disco lights performing physically complicated dance techniques while lip-synching to the song in a tuxedo. The track used for the video was the same edit used for the single, but including the spoken intro.
